properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from local areas. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ramadan Night markets on Haldon St from Tuesday 21 March to Thursday 20 April from 5pm to 3am nightly.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area, particularly on Thursday – Sunday nights during the festival.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra time as roads will be closed around Lakemba Station and detours will be in place.

The following road closures will be in place from 4pm to 3am each night from Tuesday 21 March to Thursday 20 April:

  • Haldon St between Railway Pde and The Boulevarde
  • Haldon St between 178 Haldon St and Grace Ave
  • The Boulevarde between Croydon St and Oneata Ln
  • The Boulevarde between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Gillies St between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Oneata St between Croydon St Haldon St

Follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police on site.
properties.diversions:
Southbound traffic on Haldon St north of the railway line will be detoured using Railway Pde, Moreton St, The Blvd, Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

Northbound traffic on Haldon St will be detoured using Grace Ave, Quigg St, The Blvd and Moreton St to Lakemba St.

Eastbound traffic on The Blvd west of Haldon St will be detoured using Croydon St to Canterbury Rd.

Westbound traffic on The Blvd east of Haldon St will be detoured using Quigg St, Grace Ave andHaldon St to Canterbury Rd.

NRL: Sea Eagles v Eels at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick off from 7:50pm, full-time around 10:10pm.

NRL: Roosters v Rabbitohs at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off from 8:05pm and full-time around 10:05pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave is partially closed outside the stadium from 5:05pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. Access Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd.

Special event clearways are in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementAttachments.uniqueFileName: 350648_1678159376289_Sydney Streets - Darlinghurst road closures and clearways.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Stanley Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Road closures will be in place between 9am and 11:30pm on sections of Stanley St, Riley St and Yurong St.

Motorists will be detoured via Crown Street, William Street, College Street and Francis Street.

﻿Special event clearways will also be in effect on sections of these streets from 8am until 11:30pm

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

Darlinghurst

From 9am to 11:30pm

  • Riley Street between Stanley Street and Stanley Lane
  • Riley Street between Stanley Street and Francis Lane
  • Stanley Street between Yurong Street and Crown Street
  • Yurong Street1 between William Street and Stanley Lane (Southbound)
  • Yurong Street2 between Stanley Lane and Stanley Street
  • Chapel St3 west from Crown St, along Chapel St and Francis Ln
  1. Resident only access from William Street to Yurong Street
  2. Resident only access from Yurong Street to Francis St (east of Yurong St) and Francis Lane
  3. Resident only access from Crown St, along Chapel St to Francis Lane

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

﻿Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

Darlinghurst

From 8am to 11:30pm

  • Stanley Street between Crown Street and Yurong Street (both sides)
  • Riley Street between Francis Lane and Stanley Street (Western side)
  • Riley Street between Chapel Street and Stanley Street (Eastern side)
  • Riley Street between Stanley Lane and Stanley Street (both sides)
  • Yurong Street between Stanley Street and Stanley Lane (both sides)
  • Crown Street 2 car share spaces north of Stanley Street (Western side)

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 2,400 particpants are expected to take part in this year's Bobbin Head Cycle Classic. Events start and finish at Karuah Oval in Turramurra, from 6am. All events will finish by 1:30pm. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants.

Road and lane closures will be in place along the course at various locations and times between 5am and 3pm, including on sections of Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd, Warrimoo Ave, Woodbury Rd, General San Martin Dr, Old Pacific Hwy and Mona Vale Rd through Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah, St Ives and Terry Hills. 

Speed limit reductions will be in effect at key locations at various times between 6am and 2pm.

A special event clearway will also be in place on the eastern side of a section of Mona Vale Rd in St Ives from 7am until 1:30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully for the most up-to-date information as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
TURRAMURRA - FROM 5AM TO 3PM

  • Karuah Road between Eastern Road and Turramurra Avenue (northbound)
  • Turramurra Avenue between Brentwood Avenue and Karuah Road (northbound)

KU-RING-GAI CHASE NATIONAL PARK

FROM 6:15AM TO 9:15AM

  • Bobbin Head Road between the park gates at North Turramurra and Mt Colah (northbound)

FROM 7:30AM TO 12:30PM

  • General San Martin Drive between Cottage Point Road and West Head Road (northbound)

ST IVES

FROM 6:45AM TO 1:30PM

  • Warrimoo Avenue between Killeaton Street and Mungarra Avenue (northbound)

FROM 8:30AM TO 1:30PM

  • Woodbury Road between Mona Vale Road and Hume Avenue (eastbound)

Lane closures will be progressively reopened following the event. 


MOUNT COLAH - FROM 6:15AM TO 8:45AM

  • Lane 1 Old Pacific Highway approaching the intersection of Belmont Parade (both directions)

TERREY HILLS - FROM 8AM TO 1:45PM

  • Lane 1 Mona Vale Road at the intersection of Myoora Road/Forest Way (westbound)

TURRAMURRA - FROM 8AM TO 1:45PM

  • Right turn lane Bobbin Head Rad at the intersection of Burns Road (northbound)

ST IVES

FROM 8AM TO 1:45PM

  • Lane 1 Mona Vale Road approaching the intersection of Richmond Avenue (westbound)

FROM 6AM TO 2PM

KU-RING-GAI CHASE - FROM 6AM TO 1PM

MT COLAH - FROM 5:30AM TO 9:30AM

KU-RING-GAI CHASE - FROM 6AM TO 11:30AM

St Patrick's Day celebrations will be held in The Rocks from Thursday 16 to Sunday 19 March.

On Sunday, to support the event parade road closures will be in place from 7.30am to 12pm:

  • George St between Hickson Rd at Upper Deck and Essex St
  • Harrington St from Argyle St to 66 Harrington St
  • Argyle St at Argyle Place/Lower Fort St to Harrington St
  • Hickson Rd between Upper Deck Rd and George St
  • Hickson Rd at Pottinger St

George St will be closed between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd from 5pm Thursday 16 March to 1am Monday 20 March. Special Event Clearways parking restrictions will also be in effect.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on the following roads from 4am to 10.30am on Sunday 19 March:

  • Argyle St between Lower Fort St and Harrington St (both sides)
  • Argyle St between Lower Fort St and Watson Rd (northern side)
  • George St between Hickson Rd and Argyle St (eastern side)
  • George St between Hickson Rd and Mill Ln (western side)
  • Hickson Rd between Elevated Rd (OPT Upper Car Park) and George St (both sides)
  • Harrington St between Argyle St and Suez Canal (both sides)   

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to speak to an operator and find its new location.
properties.displayName: St Patricks Day Parade and Festival

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 150 cyclists cyclists will take part in the annual Tour De Cure Signature Tour, travelling from Coffs Harbour to Noosa, Queensland, from 17-24 March. While in NSW the tour will go via Yamba, Ballina and Kingscliff, before moving into Queensland. The tour will start from 7am each day and will use a combination of local roads and the Pacific Motorway.

Friday 17 March – cyclists will travel 154km from Coffs Harbour to Yamba via West Highway St, Coramba Rd, Gale St, Orara Way, Nana St, Coramba St, Armidale Rd, Ryan St (South Grafton), Bent St, Fitzroy St (Grafton), Duke St, Victoria St, Prince St, Dobie St/Summerland Way, Queen St, Lawrence Rd, Riverbank Rd, Ensbey Rd, Bridge St, Richmond St, Rutland St, Merton St, Bluff Point Ferry, Woodford St, Cameron St, River St and Yamba Rd.

Saturday 18 March – cyclists will travel 102km from Yamba to Ballina via Yamba Rd, Pacific Highway, Watts Lane, North Arm Rd, Chatsworth Rd, Lewis Lane, Tuckombil Rd, Uralba St, River St, Langs Way, Blackwall Dr to River Dr (East Wardell), Burns Point Ferry Rd to River St (Ballina), Kingsford Smith Dr, Hill St, Compton Dr, Cedar Crescent and Compton Dr.

Sunday 19 March – cyclists will travel 93km from Ballina to Kingscliff via Kingsford Smith Dr, Hill St, Pine Ave, The Coast Rd, Byron Bay Rd, Broken Head Rd, Bangalow Rd, Browning St, Butler St, Shirley St, Ewingsdale Rd to Byron Bay interchange, Myocum Rd, Coolamon Scenic Dr, Jubilee Ace, Dalley St, Tincogan St, Brunswick Tce, Murwillumbah Rd, Brunswick Valley Way, Tweed Valley Way, Wooyung Rd, Tweed Coast Rd, Casuarina Way and Barrel St.

Monday 20 March – cyclists will travel 114km from Kingscliff to Broadbeach via Seaview St, Pearl St, Turnock St, Marina Pde, Wommin Bay Rd, Chinderah Bay Rd, Waugh St, Pacific Motorway, Sexton Hill Rd, Laura St, Pioneer Pd, View St, Cominan Av, Toolona Ave, Darlington Dr, Minjungbal Dr, Wharf St and Griffith St to the NSW/QLD border.

Motorists should be aware of cyclists using the Pacific Motorway and exercise caution. When overtaking cyclists leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits above 60km/h and a one-metre distance on roads 60km/h or below.
properties.displayName: Tour de Cure cycling - Coffs Harbour to the Queensland border

Knotfest Music Festival at Brazilian Fields, Centennial Park from midday to 10pm.

With more than 20,000 music fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual in the area as crowds travel to and from the festival.

Sections of Driver Ave, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd will close from 9pm until 11:30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will also be in place from 10am until 11pm on key roads in Surry Hills and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Parramatta Eels v Penrith Panthers at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:50pm, finish around 9:35pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game during the busy Thursday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby Waratahs v Chiefs at Allianz Stadium. Gates open 4:45pm, women's match kicks off 5:05pm, main game 7:35pm and finish 9:10pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd as fans travel to and from the game during the Friday evening peak.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before kick off and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 car park will be closed for this game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. Clearways on Flinders St will remain in effect for Mardi Gras Parade until 3am Sun 26 Feb.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event on Crown Street, from 11am until 10pm.

  • Crown St will be closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson L, Jesson St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers L will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 10:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers L. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SURRY HILLS

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Arthur St between Tudor Pl and Crown St
  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln
  • Crown St between Cleveland St and Foveaux St
  • Davies St* between Bourke St and Crown St
  • Devonshire St^ between Wilshire St and Crown St (Westbound)
  • Jesson Ln from Jesson St
  • Jesson St at Crown St
  • Lansdowne St between High Holborn St and Crown St
  • Miles St* at Crown St
  • Rainford St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Withers Ln** between Riley St and Crown St

Notes:

* Resident access permitted - contraflow to Bourke St

^Light rail corridor at Devonshire St to remain open at all times

** Resident access permitted - contraflow High Holborn St to Lansdown St


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.


SURRY HILLS

FROM 8AM UNTIL 10:30PM

  • Arthur St between Tudor Pl and Crown St
  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln
  • Crown St between Cleveland St and Foveaux St
  • Davies St between Crown St and 20m east of Crown St
  • Lansdowne St between Crown St and 20m west of Crown St
  • Rainford St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Withers Ln between Withers Pl and Crown St
